intro: Tithymalus sibthorpii, commonly known as the Sibthorp's tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk. Tithymalus sibthorpii is often found in open woodlands and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
